newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore share index blips up at close, may slip.
newsitem.headline: Singapore share index blips up at close, may slip.

text.p: Singapore's benchmark Straits Times Industrials share index (STII) blipped up just before the close of business on Tuesday amid signs of concerted buying by a small number of investors.

Dealers said buying may have been linked to unofficial over-the-counter (OTC) options or to other derivatives based on the index, which can move dramatically on relatively low volumes because it is not weighted by market capitalisation.
"If this buying is driven by derivatives, the index could easily slip back again tomorrow," said one local dealer.
The STII closed at 2,076.01, up 19.69 points.
Total market volume was a low 94.3 million shares -- around half an average day's activity -- with 209 falls and 122 gains.
Much of the day's volume was in a handful of Malaysian shares traded over-the-counter. The UOB OTC index, which tracks the sector, was down 8.91 points at 1,155.73.
Top of the volume was Malaysia's MBf Capital, which rose six cents to Singapore $2.99 on 7.7 million shares after rumours of merger talks with another financial group.
Communications firm Datacraft saw its shares rise seven percent, or 21 cents, to S$3.10 on rumours of a U.S. buy tip.
